memberdef.definition: QHash< QString, QPair< QString, bool> > QgsProject::mEmbeddedLayers
memberdef.name: mEmbeddedLayers

briefdescription.para: Embedded layers which are defined in other projects.

detaileddescription.para: Key: layer id, value: pair< project file path, save layer yes / no (e.g. if the layer is part of an embedded group, loading/saving is done by the legend) If the project file path is empty, QgsProject is going to ignore the layer for saving (e.g. because it is part and managed by an embedded group)

briefdescription.para: Manual override for project home path - if empty, home path is automatically created based on file name.

memberdef.definition: QMap< QPair< QString, QString>, QgsTransactionGroup *> QgsProject::mTransactionGroups
memberdef.name: mTransactionGroups

briefdescription.para: map of transaction group: QPair( providerKey, connString ) -> transactionGroup
Returns the QgsProject singleton instance.
Create a new QgsProject.

detaileddescription.para: Most of the time you want to use QgsProject::instance() instead as many components of QGIS work with the singleton.

briefdescription.para: Returns full absolute path to the project file if the project is stored in a file system - derived from fileName().

detaileddescription.para:
Returns empty string when the project is stored in a project storage (there is no concept of paths for custom project storages).
QGIS 3.2

briefdescription.para: Returns full absolute path to the project folder if the project is stored in a file system - derived from fileName().

detaileddescription.para:
Returns empty string when the project is stored in a project storage (there is no concept of paths for custom project storages).
QGIS 3.2

briefdescription.para: Add a layer to the map of loaded layers.

detaileddescription.para: The layersAdded() and layerWasAdded() signals will always be emitted. The legendLayersAdded() signal is emitted only if addToLegend is true. If you are adding multiple layers at once, you should use addMapLayers() instead.

parameterdescription.para: A layer to add to the registry
If true (by default), the layer will be added to the legend and to the main canvas. If you have a private layer you can set this parameter to false to hide it.
Ownership will be transferred to the layer registry. If you specify false here you have take care of deleting the layer yourself. Not available in Python.

simplesect.para: nullptr if unable to add layer, otherwise pointer to newly added layer
As a side-effect QgsProject is made dirty.
Use addMapLayers if adding more than one layer at a time
takeOwnership is not available in the Python bindings - the registry will always take ownership

memberdef.argsstring: (const QList< QgsMapLayer *> &mapLayers, bool addToLegend=true, bool takeOwnership=true)
memberdef.name: addMapLayers

briefdescription.para: Add a list of layers to the map of loaded layers.

detaileddescription.para: The layersAdded() and layerWasAdded() signals will always be emitted. The legendLayersAdded() signal is emitted only if addToLegend is true.

parameterdescription.para: A list of layer which should be added to the registry
If true (by default), the layers will be added to the legend and to the main canvas. If you have a private layer you can set this parameter to false to hide it.
Ownership will be transferred to the layer registry. If you specify false here you have take care of deleting the layers yourself. Not available in Python.

simplesect.para: a list of the map layers that were added successfully. If a layer or already exists in the registry, it will not be part of the returned QList.
As a side-effect QgsProject is made dirty.
takeOwnership is not available in the Python bindings - the registry will always take ownership

briefdescription.para: Returns pointer to the project's annotation manager.
Returns a const pointer to the project's annotation manager.
Convenience function to query default area measurement units for project.

Transactional editing means that on supported datasources (postgres databases) the edit state of all tables that originate from the same database are synchronized and executed in a server side transaction.
Returns the current const auxiliary storage.
Returns the current auxiliary storage.
A list of layers with which intersections should be avoided.
Returns the base name of the project file without the path and without extension - derived from fileName().
Clears the project, removing all settings and resetting it back to an empty, default state.
Returns the number of registered layers.
Create layer group instance defined in an arbitrary project file.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QString &layerId, const QString &projectFilePath, QList< QDomNode > &brokenNodes, bool saveFlag=true)
memberdef.name: createEmbeddedLayer

briefdescription.para: Creates a maplayer instance defined in an arbitrary project file.

detaileddescription.para:
Caller takes ownership
the layer or 0 in case of error
not available in Python bindings

briefdescription.para: This method needs to be reimplemented in all classes which implement this interface and return an expression context.
Returns the project's native coordinate reference system.
A map of custom project variables.

detaileddescription.para: To get all available variables including generated ones use QgsExpressionContextUtils::projectScope() instead.

briefdescription.para: Returns the default CRS for new layers based on the settings and the current project CRS.
Convenience function to query default distance measurement units for project.
Dump out current project properties to stderr.
Returns a proj string representing the project's ellipsoid setting, e.g., "WGS84".
Returns keys with values do not return keys that contain other keys.
Returns error message from previous read/write.
Should default values be evaluated on provider side when requested and not when committed.
Returns QFileInfo object for the project's associated file.

simplesect.para: The use of this method is discouraged since QGIS 3.2 as it only works with project files stored in the file system. It is recommended to use absoluteFilePath(), baseName(), lastModifiedTime() as replacements that are aware of the fact that projects may be saved in other project storages.

xrefdescription.para: Use absoluteFilePath(), baseName() or lastModifiedTime() instead

briefdescription.para: Returns the project's file name.

detaileddescription.para:
This is the file which contains the project's XML representation.
setFileName()
fileInfo()

briefdescription.para: Triggers the collection strings of .qgs to be included in ts file and calls writeTsFile()
Returns the project's home path.

detaileddescription.para: This will either be a manually set home path (see presetHomePath()) or the path containing the project file itself.
This method always returns the absolute path to the project's home. See presetHomePath() to retrieve any manual project home path override (e.g. relative home paths).

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the project has been modified since the last write()
Returns true if the project comes from a zip archive, false otherwise.
Returns project's global labeling engine settings.
Returns last modified time of the project file as returned by the file system (or other project storage).
Returns project file path if layer is embedded from other project file. Returns empty string if layer is not embedded.
Returns a list of registered map layers with a specified layer type.

detaileddescription.para: Example: QVector<QgsVectorLayer*> vectorLayers = QgsProject::instance()->layers<QgsVectorLayer*>();

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the project's internal layer store.

detaileddescription.para: /since QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to the project's internal layer store.

detaileddescription.para: /since QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Returns pointer to the helper class that synchronizes map layer registry with layer tree.
Returns pointer to the root (invisible) node of the project's layer tree.
Returns the project's layout manager, which manages compositions within the project.
Returns the project's layout manager, which manages compositions within the project.
Retrieve a pointer to a registered layer by layer ID.

parameterdescription.para: ID of layer to retrieve

simplesect.para: matching layer, or nullptr if no matching layer found

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a pointer to a registered layer by layerId converted to type T.

detaileddescription.para: This is a convenience template. A nullptr will be returned if the layer is not found or if it cannot be cast to type T.

briefdescription.para: Returns a map of all registered layers by layer ID.

parameterdescription.para: if set only valid layers will be returned

briefdescription.para: Retrieve a list of matching registered layers by layer name.

parameterdescription.para: name of layers to match

briefdescription.para: Returns pointer to the project's map theme collection.
Returns a reference to the project's metadata store.
Gets the list of layers which currently should not be taken into account on map identification.
Returns path resolver object with considering whether the project uses absolute or relative paths and using current project's path.
Returns any manual project home path setting, or an empty string if not set.

detaileddescription.para: This path may be a relative path. See homePath() to retrieve a path which is always an absolute path.

briefdescription.para: Returns pointer to project storage implementation that handles read/write of the project file.

detaileddescription.para:
If the project file is stored in the local file system, returns null pointer. The project storage object is inferred from fileName() of the project.
QGIS 3.2

briefdescription.para: Reads given project file from the given file.

parameterdescription.para: name of project file to read

simplesect.para: true if project file has been read successfully

briefdescription.para: Reads the project from its currently associated file (see fileName() ).

simplesect.para: true if project file has been read successfully

memberdef.argsstring: (const QString &scope, const QString &key, bool def=false, bool *ok=nullptr) const
memberdef.name: readBoolEntry

memberdef.argsstring: (const QString &scope, const QString &key, double def=0, bool *ok=nullptr) const
memberdef.name: readDoubleEntry

memberdef.argsstring: (const QString &scope, const QString &key, const QString &def=QString(), bool *ok=nullptr) const
memberdef.name: readEntry

briefdescription.para: Reads the layer described in the associated DOM node.

simplesect.para: This method is mainly for use by QgsProjectBadLayerHandler subclasses that may fix definition of bad layers with the user's help in GUI. Calling this method with corrected DOM node adds the layer back to the project.

parameterdescription.para: represents a QgsProject DOM node that encodes a specific layer.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QString &scope, const QString &key, const QStringList &def=QStringList(), bool *ok=nullptr) const
memberdef.name: readListEntry

briefdescription.para: Key value accessors.

detaileddescription.para: keys would be the familiar QgsSettings-like '/' delimited entries, implying a hierarchy of keys and corresponding values

memberdef.argsstring: (const QString &scope, const QString &key, int def=0, bool *ok=nullptr) const
memberdef.name: readNumEntry

briefdescription.para: Turn filename read from the project file to an absolute path.
Reload all registered layer's provider data caches, synchronising the layer with any changes in the datasource.
Removes all registered layers.

detaileddescription.para: If the registry has ownership of any layers these layers will also be deleted.

simplesect.para: As a side-effect the QgsProject instance is marked dirty.
Calling this method will cause the removeAll() signal to be emitted.

briefdescription.para: Remove the given key.
Remove a layer from the registry by layer ID.

detaileddescription.para: The specified layer will be removed from the registry. If the registry has ownership of the layer then it will also be deleted.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the layer to remove

simplesect.para: As a side-effect the QgsProject instance is marked dirty.

briefdescription.para: Remove a layer from the registry.

detaileddescription.para: The specified layer will be removed from the registry. If the registry has ownership of the layer then it will also be deleted.

parameterdescription.para: The layer to remove. Null pointers are ignored.

simplesect.para: As a side-effect the QgsProject instance is marked dirty.

briefdescription.para: Remove a set of layers from the registry by layer ID.

detaileddescription.para: The specified layers will be removed from the registry. If the registry has ownership of any layers these layers will also be deleted.

parameterdescription.para: list of IDs of the layers to remove

simplesect.para: As a side-effect the QgsProject instance is marked dirty.

briefdescription.para: Remove a set of layers from the registry.

detaileddescription.para: The specified layers will be removed from the registry. If the registry has ownership of any layers these layers will also be deleted.

parameterdescription.para: A list of layers to remove. Null pointers are ignored.

simplesect.para: As a side-effect the QgsProject instance is marked dirty.

briefdescription.para: Returns a set of map layers that are required in the project and therefore they should not get removed from the project.

detaileddescription.para:
The set of layers may be configured by users in project properties. and it is mainly a hint for the user interface to protect users from removing layers that important in the project. The removeMapLayer(), removeMapLayers() calls do not block removal of layers listed here. Deprecated
since QGIS 3.4 use QgsMapLayer::flags() instead
QGIS 3.2

briefdescription.para: Sets the default area measurement units for the project.

Transactional editing means that on supported datasources (postgres databases) the edit state of all tables that originate from the same database are synchronized and executed in a server side transaction.

detaileddescription.para: Make sure that this is only called when all layers are not in edit mode.

briefdescription.para: A list of layers with which intersections should be avoided.
Change handler for missing layers.

detaileddescription.para: Deletes old handler and takes ownership of the new one.

briefdescription.para: Sets the project's native coordinate reference system.
A map of custom project variables.

detaileddescription.para: Be careful not to set generated variables.

briefdescription.para: Sets the default distance measurement units for the project.
Sets the project's ellipsoid from a proj string representation, e.g., "WGS84".
Defines if default values should be evaluated on provider side when requested and not when committed.
Sets the file name associated with the project.

detaileddescription.para:
This is the file which contains the project's XML representation.
name
project file name
fileName()

briefdescription.para: Sets project's global labeling engine settings.
Sets the project's metadata store.
Set a list of layers which should not be taken into account on map identification.
Set a list of layers which should not be taken into account on map identification.
Sets the colors for the project's color scheme (see QgsProjectColorScheme).
Configures a set of map layers that are required in the project and therefore they should not get removed from the project.

detaileddescription.para:
The set of layers may be configured by users in project properties. and it is mainly a hint for the user interface to protect users from removing layers that important in the project. The removeMapLayer(), removeMapLayers() calls do not block removal of layers listed here. Deprecated
since QGIS 3.4 use QgsMapLayer::setFlags() instead
QGIS 3.2

briefdescription.para: Sets the project's title.

parameterdescription.para: new title

simplesect.para: Since QGIS 3.2 this is just a shortcut to setting the title in the project's metadata().

briefdescription.para: Convenience function to set topological editing.

Sets the project's coordinate transform context, which stores various information regarding which datum transforms should be used when transforming points from a source to destination coordinate reference system.
Sets the trust option allowing to indicate if the extent has to be read from the XML document when data source has no metadata or if the data provider has to determine it.

detaileddescription.para: Moreover, when this option is activated, primary key unicity is not checked for views and materialized views with Postgres provider.

parameterdescription.para: True to trust the project, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: The snapping configuration for this project.
Returns keys with keys do not return keys that contain only values.
Takes a layer from the registry.

detaileddescription.para:
If the layer was owned by the project, the layer will be returned without deleting it. The caller takes ownership of the layer and is responsible for deleting it.
removeMapLayer()
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Returns the project's title.

simplesect.para: Since QGIS 3.2 this is just a shortcut to retrieving the title from the project's metadata().

briefdescription.para: Convenience function to query topological editing status.
Returns the matching transaction group from a provider key and connection string.

detaileddescription.para: Returns nullptr if a matching transaction group is not available.

memberdef.definition: QMap< QPair< QString, QString >, QgsTransactionGroup * > QgsProject::transactionGroups
memberdef.name: transactionGroups

briefdescription.para: Map of transaction groups.

detaileddescription.para: QPair( providerKey, connString ) -> transactionGroup

briefdescription.para: Returns a copy of the project's coordinate transform context, which stores various information regarding which datum transforms should be used when transforming points from a source to destination coordinate reference system.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QString &context, const QString &sourceText, const char *disambiguation=nullptr, int n=-1) const override
memberdef.name: translate

briefdescription.para: Translates the project with QTranslator and qm file.

simplesect.para: the result string (in case there is no QTranslator loaded the sourceText)

parameterdescription.para: describing layer etc.
is the identifier of this text
it's the disambiguation
if -1 uses the appropriate form

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the trust option is activated, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: This option allows indicateing if the extent has to be read from the XML document when data source has no metadata or if the data provider has to determine it. Moreover, when this option is activated, primary key unicity is not checked for views and materialized views with Postgres provider.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of registered valid layers.
Writes the project to a file.

parameterdescription.para: destination file

simplesect.para: true if project was written successfully
calling this implicitly sets the project's filename (see setFileName() )
isDirty() will be set to false if project is successfully written

briefdescription.para: Writes the project to its current associated file (see fileName() ).

simplesect.para: true if project was written successfully
isDirty() will be set to false if project is successfully written

briefdescription.para: Write a boolean entry to the project file.

detaileddescription.para: Keys are '/'-delimited entries, implying a hierarchy of keys and corresponding values

simplesect.para: The key string must be valid xml tag names in order to be saved to the file.
available in Python bindings as writeEntryBool

briefdescription.para: Write a double entry to the project file.

detaileddescription.para: Keys are '/'-delimited entries, implying a hierarchy of keys and corresponding values

simplesect.para: The key string must be valid xml tag names in order to be saved to the file.
available in Python bindings as writeEntryDouble

briefdescription.para: Write an integer entry to the project file.

detaileddescription.para: Keys are '/'-delimited entries, implying a hierarchy of keys and corresponding values

simplesect.para: The key string must be valid xml tag names in order to be saved to the file.

briefdescription.para: Write a string entry to the project file.

detaileddescription.para: Keys are '/'-delimited entries, implying a hierarchy of keys and corresponding values

simplesect.para: The key string must be valid xml tag names in order to be saved to the file.

briefdescription.para: Write a string list entry to the project file.

detaileddescription.para: Keys are '/'-delimited entries, implying a hierarchy of keys and corresponding values

simplesect.para: The key string must be valid xml tag names in order to be saved to the file.

briefdescription.para: Prepare a filename to save it to the project file.

detaileddescription.para: Creates an absolute or relative path according to the project settings. Paths written to the project file should be prepared with this method.

briefdescription.para: Emitted whenever avoidIntersectionsLayers has changed.
Emitted when the project is cleared (and additionally when an open project is cleared just before a new project is read).
Emitted when the CRS of the project has changed.
Emitted whenever the expression variables stored in the project have been changed.
Emitted when the project ellipsoid is changed.
Emitted when the file name of the project changes.
Emitted when the home path of the project changes.
Emitted when the project dirty status changes.

parameterdescription.para: True if the project is in a dirty state and has pending unsaved changes.

briefdescription.para: Emitted when global configuration of the labeling engine changes.
Emitted when a layer from a projects was read.

parameterdescription.para: current layer
number of layers

briefdescription.para: Emitted after a layer was removed from the registry.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the layer removed.

briefdescription.para: Emitted when one or more layers were added to the registry.

detaileddescription.para: This signal is also emitted for layers added to the registry, but not to the legend.

parameterdescription.para: List of layers which have been added.

briefdescription.para: Emitted after one or more layers were removed from the registry.

parameterdescription.para: A list of IDs of the layers which were removed.

briefdescription.para: Emitted when one or more layers are about to be removed from the registry.

parameterdescription.para: A list of IDs for the layers which are to be removed.

briefdescription.para: Emitted when one or more layers are about to be removed from the registry.

parameterdescription.para: A list of layers which are to be removed.

briefdescription.para: Emitted when a layer was added to the registry.
Emitted when a layer is about to be removed from the registry.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the layer to be removed.

briefdescription.para: Emitted when a layer is about to be removed from the registry.

parameterdescription.para: The layer to be removed.

briefdescription.para: Emitted, when a layer was added to the registry and the legend.

detaileddescription.para: Layers can also be private layers, which are signalled by layersAdded() and layerWasAdded() but will not be advertised by this signal.

parameterdescription.para: List of QgsMapLayer which were added to the legend.

briefdescription.para: Emitted when a layer is loaded.
Emitted when loading layers has produced some messages.

parameterdescription.para: the layer name
a list of pairs of Qgis::MessageLevel and messages

briefdescription.para: Emitted when the map theme collection changes.

detaileddescription.para: This only happens when the map theme collection is reset. Any pointer previously received from mapThemeCollection() must no longer be used after this signal is emitted. You must still connect to signals from the map theme collection if you want to be notified about new map themes being added and map themes being removed.

briefdescription.para: Emitted when the project's metadata is changed.
Emitted when datum transforms stored in the project are not available locally.
Emitted when the list of layer which are excluded from map identification changes.
Emitted when an old project file is read.
Emitted whenever the project's color scheme has been changed.
Emitted when the project file has been written and closed.
Emitted after the basic initialization of a layer from the project file is done.

detaileddescription.para: You can use this signal to read additional information from the project file.

parameterdescription.para: The map layer which is being initialized
The layer node from the project file

briefdescription.para: Emitted when a project is being read.
Emitted when a project is being read.

detaileddescription.para: And passing the /a context

briefdescription.para: Emitted when all layers are removed, before layersWillBeRemoved() and layerWillBeRemoved() signals are emitted.

detaileddescription.para: The layersWillBeRemoved() and layerWillBeRemoved() signals will still be emitted following this signal. You can use this signal to do easy (and fast) cleanup.

briefdescription.para: Emitted whenever the configuration for snapping has changed.
Emitted when the topological editing flag has changed.
Emitted whenever a new transaction group has been created or a transaction group has been removed.
Emitted when the project transformContext() is changed.
Emitted when a layer is being saved.

detaileddescription.para: You can use this method to save additional information to the layer.

parameterdescription.para: The map layer which is being initialized
The layer element from the project file
The document

briefdescription.para: Emitted when the project is being written.
Registers the containers that require translation into the translationContext.

detaileddescription.para: This is a recursive function to get all the child containers.

parameterdescription.para: where the objects will be registered
parent-container containing list of children
to store under the correct context

briefdescription.para: Registers the objects that require translation into the translationContext.

detaileddescription.para: So there can be created a ts file with these values.

briefdescription.para: Flag the project as dirty (modified).

detaileddescription.para: If this flag is set, the user will be asked to save changes to the project before closing the current project.

briefdescription.para: Sets the project's home path.

detaileddescription.para:
If an empty path is specified than the home path will be automatically determined from the project's file path.
presetHomePath()
homePath()
homePathChanged()
QGIS 3.2

briefdescription.para: The snapping configuration for this project.
Set the current project instance to project.

simplesect.para: this is used mainly by the server, which caches the projects and (potentially) needs to switch the current instance on every request

briefdescription.para: Read map layers from project file.

parameterdescription.para: DOM document to parse
a list of DOM nodes corresponding to layers that we were unable to load; this could be because the layers were removed or re-located after the project was last saved

simplesect.para: true if function worked; else is false

briefdescription.para: Creates layer and adds it to maplayer registry.
Clear error message.
Read .qgs file.
Save auxiliary storage to database.
Set error message from read/write operation.
Unzip .qgz file then read embedded .qgs file.
Write .qgs file.
Zip project.
Reads and writes project states.

detaileddescription.para: Has two general kinds of state to make persistent. (I.e., to read and write.) First, QGIS proprietary information. Second plug-in information.
A singleton since there shall only be one active project at a time; and provides canonical location for plug-ins and main app to find/set properties.
